gurmukhi: qurw gr bbwXd kauil kurwN ]binzdy Sumw rw rswnm hmwN ]57]
transliteration: Turaa Gad Babaayad Kaule Kuraan|| Banizade Shoumaa Raa Rasaanam Hamaan||57||
translation: If you want to see the letter containing oaths, I can send you the same immediatedly.57.

gurmukhi: ik qSrIP dr ksbh kwNgV kund ]vzwN ps mulwkwq bwhm Svd ]58]
transliteration: Ki Tashreef Dar Kashah Kaanad Kounad|| Vazaan Pas Mulaakaat Baaham Shaved||58||
translation: If you come yourself in village Kangar, we can meet each other.58.

gurmukhi: n z`rh drIN rwih ^qrh qurwsq ]hmh kOim bYrwV hukim mrwsq ]59]
transliteration: Na Zarrah Dareen Raahe Khatrah Turaasat|| Hamah Kaoume Bairaad Houkame Maraasat||59||
translation: Do not bring in your mind the danger of coming there; because the Brar community acts according to my orders.59.

gurmukhi: ibXw qw su^n ^ud zbwnI kunym ]brUey Sumw imhrbwnI kunym ]60]
transliteration: Biyaa Taa Soukhan Khud Zabaanikounem|| Badooe Shoumaa Meharbaanikounem||60||
translation: We can talk to each other in this way; kindly come so that we may have direct talk.60.

gurmukhi: Xky Asp Swiesqhey Xk hzwr ]ibXw qw bgIrI b mn eIN idXwr ]61]
transliteration: Yake Asp Shaistah-e Yak Hazaar|| Biyaa Taa Bageeriba Man Een Diyaar||61||
translation: Your saying that I may bring for you a very fine steed of one thousand rupees and get this area as a feoff (jagir) from you, you may keep this thing in your mind.61.

gurmukhi: SihnSwih rw bMdhy cwkrym ]Agr hukm AwXd bjw hwzrym ]62]
transliteration: Shahinshaahe Raa Bandah-e Chaakrem|| Amar Houkam Aayad Bajaa Haazrem||62||
translation: I am the man of the Sovereign of Sovereign and His slave; if He permits me, then I shall present myself there.62.

gurmukhi: Agrich ibAwXd b &rmwn mn ]hzUrq ibXwXm hmh jwnu qn ]63]
transliteration: Agadchih Biaayad Ha Farmaan Man|| Hazoorat Biyaayam Hamoh Jaanu Tan||63||
translation: If He permits me, then I shall be present there in person.63.

gurmukhi: Agr qU bXzdwN prsqI kunI ]b kwry mrw eIN n susqI kunI ]64]
transliteration: Agad Too Bayazdaan Parastikounee|| Ba Kdare Maraa Een Na Soustisounee||64||
translation: If you worship One Lord, you will not cause any delay in this work of mine.64.

gurmukhi: ibbwXd ik XzdwN SnwsI kunI ]n Zu&qh kswN ks ^rwSI kunI ]65]
transliteration: Bibaayad Ki Yazdaan Shanaasikounee|| Na Gufrah Kasan Kas Kharaashikounee||65||
translation: You should recognize the Lord, so that you may not talk ill or cause injury to anybody.65.

gurmukhi: qu msnd nSIN srvir kwienwq ]ik Ajb Asq iensw& eIN hm s&wq ]66]
transliteration: Tu Masnad Nasheen Sardare Kaaenaat|| Ki Ajab Ast Insaaf Een Ham Safaat||66||
translation: You are the Sovereign of the world and you sit on the throne, but I wonder at your ill acts of injustice.66.

gurmukhi: ik Ajb Asq iensw&o dIN prvrI ]ik hY& Asq sd hY& eIN srvrI ]67]
transliteration: Ki Ajab Ast Insaafo Deen Pardaree|| Ki Haif Ast Sad Haif Een Sardaree||67||
translation: I wonder at your acts of piety and justice; I feel sorry at your sovereignty.67.

gurmukhi: ik Ajb Asqu Ajb Asqu qkvw SumwN ]bjuz rwsqI su^n gu&qn zXwN ]68]
transliteration: Ki Ajab Ast(i) Ajab Ast(u) Takvaa Shoumaan|| Bahuz Raastisoukhan Guftan Zayaan||68||
translation: I wonder very much regarding your faith; anything said against truth brings downfall.68.

gurmukhi: mzn qyZ br ^Uin ks by dryZ ]qurw nIz ^UM crK ryzd bqyZ ]69]
transliteration: Mazan Tegh Bar Khoone Kas Be Dregh|| Turaa Neez Khoon Charkh Rezad Ba-tegh||69||
translation: Do not be rash in striking your sword on helpless, otherwise the Providence will shed your blood.69.

gurmukhi: qU gw&l mSau mrd XzdwN ihrws ]ik E byinAwz Asq E byispws ]70]
transliteration: Too Gadfil Mashau Mard Yazdaan Hiraas|| Ki O Beniaaz Ast O Besipaas||70||
translation: Do not be careless, recognize the Lord, who is averse to greed and flattery.70.
